instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Its a previous repair attempt, initially it wasn't turning on, fixed it and now there is no backlight, i checked backlight enable and that was low, so i tracked it and found that <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is around 1.9v, removed <RESISTOR>R5050</RESISTOR> and its a  partial short, diode mode measurement is 0.081 and i have already reflowed smc and removed <TRANSISTOR>Q5701</TRANSISTOR> and nothing has changed so far, any other ideas apart from reballing or changing smc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Remove <CAPACITOR>C5050</CAPACITOR> and check if <RESISTOR>R5071</RESISTOR> is OK.
If all correct, remove SMC and check again.
Probably short will go then, meaning bad SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Already did that, i think its smc and i don't have stencils for it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
It has aprox 150 balls.
I did more than one at hand...
Use 0.35mm, but even 0.4-0.45mm works.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Will smc from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> work?? The schematics says they are same, but now board is not even turning on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: You MUST take SMC from the same donor board model...
